page.title: 06DRAINAGE/IRRIGATION WEST ROW
page.content: DRAINAGE WORK HAS BEEN GOING ON IN THE FENS FOR HUNDREDS OF YEARS. BY THE EARLY 19TH CENTURY ALL BUT A FEW AREAS HAD BEEN DRAINED AND FARMED. NOWADAYS WATER IS MOVED FROM THE FIELDS INTO THE RIVERS BY MODERN ELECTRIC PUMPS INSTEAD OF WINDMILLS. WEST ROW IS SITUATED AT THE EDGE OF THE FENS AND THOUGH SOME OF THE LAND IS FREE-DRAINING, MOST FARMERS PAY A SPECIAL RATE TO THE MILDENHALL FEN DRAINAGE BOARD. THE BOARD ORGANISES AND CONTROLS THE LOCAL DRAINAGE, MAIN- TAINS THE PUMPING STATION AND KEEPS THE FIELD DRAINS CLEAR. THIS REGION HAS THE LOWEST RAINFALL IN THE COUNTRY, AND IRRIGATION IS ESSENTIAL FOR MAXIMUM YIELDS.IRONICALLY MANY FARMERS FIND THEMSELVES PAYING TWO RATES - ONE TO HAVE WATER TAKEN OFF THEIR LAND AND ANOTHER TO PUT IT BACK!
